body: PHPUnit 10 and PHPUnit 11 also use this constant.

rename.to: Deprecation of the `E_STRICT` constant in PHP 8.4

body: @mvorisek Do you have any insight? Thanks!

I support the patch above but `@` is needed before `constant('E_STRICT')` - https://3v4l.org/qIUg9/rfc#vgit.master

you can also simplify `@constant('E_STRICT')` into `@E_STRICT` - https://3v4l.org/B60NO/rfc#vgit.master
That was fast, thank you very much!

issue.title: [5.x] PHP 8.4 Support

repository.name: cms
repository.description: The core Laravel CMS Composer package

issue.body:
This pull request adds PHP 8.4 support.

Statamic itself is compatible with PHP 8.4, however, some packages we're using still need to be updated to support it, otherwise users may see deprecation notices.

* [x] `voku/portable-ascii`: https://github.com/voku/portable-ascii/pull/105
* [ ] `thecodingmachine/safe`: https://github.com/thecodingmachine/safe/pull/441
* [x] `rebing/graphql-laravel`: https://github.com/rebing/graphql-laravel/pull/1152

body: The error is still present for me, in `/var/www/html/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Runner/ErrorHandler.php` line 93. I'm using PHP 8.4.6.

issue.title: Handling of E_STRICT in PHP 8.4

repository.name: safe
repository.description: All PHP functions, rewritten to throw exceptions instead of returning false

issue.body:
I have a PHPUnit (v12.1) test using scandir(). The test fails with the exception:

`Constant E_STRICT is deprecated`

After debugging, I traced the issue to this block in PHPUnits ErrorHandler.php:
https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/12.1/src/Runner/ErrorHandler.php#L93
(Reference comment: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5956#issuecomment-2839280772)

When I remove the three lines handling E_STRICT, the error changes to a generic:

`An error occurred.`

However, the more accurate and expected message should be:

`Failed to open directory: No such file or directory`

I updated from phpunit 9 to 12. The expected exception message did not change in the test.

body:
@4d4ch4u32 You are the only/first to report that the change implemented in d7d8e73cfc78788ff6c77575e2e7657401282bf2 does not work for them.

I do not understand why the change you propose should be required. Can you please share details about how the current implementation causes an issue for you? Thanks!

I have a PHPUnit (v12.1) test using `scandir()` (provided by thecodingmachine/safe) to test the behaviour of my code if the scanned folder does not exist. The test fails with an exception. An exception is expected here, but not with the message: `Constant E_STRICT is deprecated`. With my proposed change, the error message is (as expected) `An error has occurred.` I upgraded from phpunit 9 to 12.

This is possible when the/your error handler does not handle `@` operator well - see https://github.com/atk4/ui/blob/5.2.0/src/App.php#L199.

https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/d7d8e73cfc78788ff6c77575e2e7657401282bf2 might be improved to access the constant using reflection instead of error suppression (`@`) operator.
According to https://3v4l.org/18eA4, the value of `E_STRICT` is always `2048`. Therefore we should be fine to check against a literal `2048` instead of against `@E_STRICT`.

I am fine with that assumption.

https://3v4l.org/d9GHV solution might be cleaner, but it should be evaluated only once as it might be slow otherwise.
